This support includes a Partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career as well as up to five weeks of formal training in your few years. Additionally, you’ll receive guidance and support from your local office or practice in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network. While all consultants develop specialized knowledge and a focused program as they progress with McKinsey, most are initially very broad in their focus, meaning they do not need specific industry or functional expertise to be successful. For consultants who join Advice as experienced professionals, this can mean building on previous knowledge or developing unique experience in an area that is completely new.[/advice_text_block][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Healthcare Market Research Consultant
item.dc:creator: dev
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][advice_heading tag="h2" title="Essential Duties & Responsibilities" css=".vc_custom_1496032354228{margin-bottom: 28px !important;}"][advice_text_block css=".vc_custom_1496032483392{margin-bottom: 52px !important;}"]
  • Competitive data gathering, including primary research, third party research, and competitor public information.
  • Analysis of competitive information, including development of competitive strategies in partnership with Sales, Product Management, Marketing and Product Marketing.
  • Interfaces with influential consultants and market participants to understand win/loss strategies.
  • Publication of competitive information and assets on internal web sites, as well as tailored tools for the Sales team.
  • Presentation and communication of findings to interested parties as needed.
  • Analysis of research results and presentation of findings to Product Management and executive teams, as well as other functions within the organization.
  • Management and execution of comprehensive win/loss client interview process
  • Research and management of a comprehensive partner and adjacent market vendor fact book.
  • Management of market intelligence fact book – monitoring and aggregating metrics of key market trends and data
  • Comprehensive management of vendor/partner factbook – updating the management team on market dynamics in adjacent spaces – including but not exclusive to venture and private equity activities in the Healthcare IT market.
[/advice_text_block][vc_separator css=".vc_custom_1496032443341{margin-bottom: 53px !important;}"][advice_heading tag="h2" title="Experience" css=".vc_custom_1496032447597{margin-bottom: 28px !important;}"][advice_text_block]

Minimum Qualifications

  • 1-2 years in corporate strategy/marketing/competitive intelligence

Skills/Knowledge

  • Proficiency with MS Office and Windows, expert Excel user a plus
  • Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Organization and time management skills
  • Ability to manage multiple, multi-faceted projects and deadlines
  • Strong interpersonal skills, characterized by being able to work with others, readily accepting constructive comments, and willingness to learn.
  • Strong degree of creativity is a plus.
  • Ability to read and understand public financial statements and proficient in developing financial models in excel.
[/advice_text_block][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Manage all phases of Advice Health’s competitive and market intelligence processes. Acts as the focal point for competitive data gathering and analysis, and communication of competitive strategies. Responsibilities comprise include competitive data gathering, analysis, maintenance competitive sales and marketing enablement assets, and presentation of findings to the Sales, Marketing and executive leadership teams.
